definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: In a vehicle with manual transmission, you may downshift into a lower gear as you slow down.
sentences.chinese: 手動檔車輛，降低車速的同時，換低至合適檔位。

sentences.english: A bicycle handle is provided with a variable resistor for adjustment of bicycle speed.
sentences.chinese: 車把上設有可調節車速的可變電阻。

sentences.english: Mansell will race at average speeds approaching 200mph.
sentences.chinese: 曼塞爾將以接近每小時200英里的平均車速參賽。

sentences.english: He sped his car off the accidental site.
sentences.chinese: 他加快車速駛離了出事地點。

sentences.english: My senses felt heightened with the surrounding beauty. I slowed the car.
sentences.chinese: 這美麗的環境讓我心動不已，我降低了車速。

sentences.english: Heavily loading a vehicle or towing a trailer may reduce fuel economy at any speed.
sentences.chinese: 任何車速下的重載或拖掛都會降低燃油經濟性。

sentences.english: The driver changed down from third to second.
sentences.chinese: 駕駛員將車速從第三檔調低到第二檔。

sentences.english: The speed of motor vehicles is restricted to 55km per hour.
sentences.chinese: 車速限制在每小時五十五公里之內。

sentences.english: By reasonable control, the energy feedback can be realized at very low vehicle speed.
sentences.chinese: 通過合理控制，即使在較低車速時也可實現能量反饋。

sentences.english: The dashboard has just a speedometer and two simple gauges for fuel and mileage.
sentences.chinese: 汽車儀表盤上只有一個車速計及油量和里程錶。
我的車速降到了每小時5英里。

sentences.english: But, is all hill path there, the car soon lifts not to go up forever.
sentences.chinese: 可是，那裏都是山路，車速永遠提不上去。

sentences.english: When he caromed off the wall, he was going 86 miles an hour.
sentences.chinese: 當他駛離水泥牆，車速依然達每小時86英里。

sentences.english: By the third lap Kinkead had touched 289 m. p. h .
sentences.chinese: 到第三圈時，金基德的車速達到了每小時289英里。

sentences.english: Their progress was exasperatingly slow, but we were beyond exasperation.
sentences.chinese: 車速很慢，令人惱怒，但我們何止是惱怒呢。

sentences.english: The speed has been slowed down to 20 miles an hour.
sentences.chinese: 車速被放慢到每小時20英里。

definition: to travel along a route (of vehicles etc)
to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
to reduce speed/to slow down/to take it easy
to avoid/to yield (in traffic)/to get out of the way
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
